wiki.content: "I Want to Hold Your Hand" is a song by the English pop rock band The Beatles. Written by John Lennon and Paul McCartney, and recorded in October 1963, it was the first Beatles record to be made using four-track equipment. McCartney and Lennon did not have any particular inspiration for the song. Instead, they had received specific instructions from manager Brian Epstein to write a song with the American market in mind. According to the I Want To Hold Your Hand Songfacts, John Lennon and Paul McCartney wrote this in Jane Asher's basement. Asher was an actress who became Paul's first high-profile girlfriend. After appearing in several movies, TV shows and stage productions, Asher became an authority on baking, and has her own business selling party cakes and supplying baking and decorating equipment. She and Paul broke up in 1968. "I Want to Hold Your Hand" was the band's first number-one hit on the Billboard Hot 100 chart, starting the British Invasion of the United States music charts. It also held the top spot in the United Kingdom charts. A million copies of the single had already been ordered on its release. "I Want to Hold Your Hand" became The Beatles' best-selling single worldwide. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "I Want to Hold Your Hand" is a song by the English pop rock band The Beatles. Written by John Lennon and Paul McCartney, and recorded in October 1963, it was the first Beatles record to be made using four-track equipment. McCartney and Lennon did not have any particular inspiration for the song. Instead, they had received specific instructions from manager Brian Epstein to write a song with the American market in mind.

track.name: I Want to Hold Your Hand
comments: A jiggy one from the fab 4
clapping along to that song is actually pretty hard, isn't it?
I thought that iTunes hogged all the rights to the Beatles music?
The song that started it all in America
what a trip back in time to The Ed Sullivan show in 1963(?) marking the USA debut of the fab4
i wanna hold yours too guys
the title of this song is a euphemism
Fabulous song! Nothing makes me feel better than early Beatles.
OH YEAH !!!!! AWESOME CLASSIC AND THE ONE THAT GOT THEM GOING ! I THINK !!!
When I touch you I feel happy!!! :)
when I hear this song, I feel happy *-* [5]
My mother loved this song, I hear since was a baby
